seg-source.mrk: Allocation Type

target.mrk: 分配類型

trans-unit.source: Summary of processes that take place during allocation.

seg-source.mrk: Summary of processes that take place during allocation.

target.mrk: 執行分配期間的程序摘要。

seg-source.mrk: Definition

target.mrk: 定義

trans-unit.source: Allocation types are a summary of the processes that can take place during allocation. You can select an allocation type when creating an allocation cycle in the <uicontrol>Manage Allocations</uicontrol> app.

seg-source.mrk: Allocation types are a summary of the processes that can take place during allocation.
You can select an allocation type when creating an allocation cycle in the <uicontrol>Manage Allocations</uicontrol> app.

target.mrk: 分配類型為分配期間程序的摘要。
當在 <uicontrol>[管理分配]</uicontrol> 應用程式建立分配週期時，您可選擇分配類型。

trans-unit.source: Depending on your use case, you can choose between the following types of allocations:

seg-source.mrk: Depending on your use case, you can choose between the following types of allocations:

target.mrk: 依據使用案例，您可選擇下列分類配型：

seg-source.mrk: <uicontrol>Distribution</uicontrol>

target.mrk: <uicontrol>分配</uicontrol>

trans-unit.source: In distribution, amounts and quantities of one or more sender objects are distributed to one or more receiver objects, from service cost centers to production cost centers, for example.

seg-source.mrk: In distribution, amounts and quantities of one or more sender objects are distributed to one or more receiver objects, from service cost centers to production cost centers, for example.

target.mrk: 在分配時，一或多個傳送者物件的金額和數量會分配給一或多個接收者物件。例如，從服務成本中心分配到生產成本中心。

trans-unit.source: The G/L account postings for the distribution occur under the original account/original cost element with which the amounts and quantities are posted at the sender. The information of the original account/original cost element remains intact. You can carry out distribution with both actual and plan data.

seg-source.mrk: The G/L account postings for the distribution occur under the original account/original cost element with which the amounts and quantities are posted at the sender.
The information of the original account/original cost element remains intact.
You can carry out distribution with both actual and plan data.

target.mrk: 總帳科目會在原始科目/原始成本要素下方過帳至分配，金額和數量會於傳送者方過帳。
原始科目/原始成本要素的資訊會保留不變。
您可同時使用實際和計劃資料執行分配。

seg-source.mrk: <uicontrol>Overhead Allocation</uicontrol>

target.mrk: <uicontrol>間接成本分配</uicontrol>

trans-unit.source: With overhead allocation, the amounts are posted to separate overhead allocation accounts rather than to the original accounts.

seg-source.mrk: With overhead allocation, the amounts are posted to separate overhead allocation accounts rather than to the original accounts.

target.mrk: 執行間接成本分配時，金額會過帳至個別間接成本分配科目，而不是原始科目。

trans-unit.source: These overhead allocation accounts bundle actual/plan data posted on various primary accounts and give them a new meaning. The information from the original account/original cost element is lost.

seg-source.mrk: These overhead allocation accounts bundle actual/plan data posted on various primary accounts and give them a new meaning.
The information from the original account/original cost element is lost.

target.mrk: 這些間接成本分配科目會分組於多個主要科目過帳的實際/計劃資料，並賦予新意義。
來自原始科目/原始成本要素的資訊將會移失。

trans-unit.source: Overhead allocations are performed if the original composition of the actual/plan data does not contain any important information for the receiver but the label of the overhead allocation account does.

seg-source.mrk: Overhead allocations are performed if the original composition of the actual/plan data does not contain any important information for the receiver but the label of the overhead allocation account does.

target.mrk: 若實際/計劃資料的原始組成未包含對接收者重要的資訊，但間接成本分配科目的標籤包含重要資訊，間接成本分配將會執行。

seg-source.mrk: <uicontrol>Top-down Distribution</uicontrol>

target.mrk: <uicontrol>由上而下分配</uicontrol>

trans-unit.source: You use top-down distribution to distribute aggregated amounts and quantities to a more detailed level based on reference information.

seg-source.mrk: You use top-down distribution to distribute aggregated amounts and quantities to a more detailed level based on reference information.

target.mrk: 您可使用由上而下分配，依據參考資訊，將彙總金額和數量分配到更細層次。

trans-unit.source: For example, freight invoices cannot easily be assigned to the product level. Therefore, you post it at a summarized level, such as the product group, and then use top-down distribution to distribute the amounts to a more detailed level, such as the product, by using sales revenue for each product as a reference.

seg-source.mrk: For example, freight invoices cannot easily be assigned to the product level.

Therefore, you post it at a summarized level, such as the product group, and then use top-down distribution to distribute the amounts to a more detailed level, such as the product, by using sales revenue for each product as a reference.

target.mrk: 例如，無法輕易將運費發票指派給產品層次。
因此，您可在彙總層次過帳，例如產品群組，並透過由下而上分配，使用各產品的銷售收入作為參考，將金額分配到更細層次，例如產品。
